context: The Finnish word 'kapteeni' is a noun that means captain or commander. It refers to the person in command of a vessel (ship), aircraft, military unit, or team. The word can be used for both maritime captains and military officers holding the rank of captain. In compound words, it may appear in different forms such as 'kapteeniksi' (as captain) or possessive form 'kapteinin' (of the captain).
